results.title: Solar energy: how it works
results.brief_description: In order that energy from the sun be used it must be either concentrated, absorbed, trapped or converted. Simple experiments by children and commercial applications provide examples of how this can be done.

results.title: Man and the soil
results.brief_description: Examines soil types and the processes used to map soils. Also notes the vulnerability of soils to manmade influences and possible means to counteract these detrimental effects.

results.title: Choking
results.brief_description: Covers first aid for choking in a variety of situations, using practical demonstrations and animation to explain procedures. Also covers aspects of self-help and first aid for pregnant women who are choking.

results.title: Volleyball: a sport come of age
results.brief_description:
Provides a brief history of the development of the game of volleyball and moves on to show the current American volleyball scene with the main emphasis on beach volleyball.
Suitable for upper primary and lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Fall-line
results.brief_description: Compares the similarities of handling body movement in four sports which have been made posible by new technology: skateboarding, surfing, skiing and hang gliding. Additional script material by Bert Deling.

results.title: First it seemed kinda strange
results.brief_description: Les’s parents divorced five years ago and he then went to live with his mother. He visits his father and stepmother on weekends and vacations and seems to have adjusted to this arrangement. This film raises issues surrounding social awareness and self awareness; divorce; family roles and relationships; and communication. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Tell-tale heart
results.brief_description: Adaption of the Edgar Allan Poe tale of a manservant (Alex Cord), quite mad but telling the story to convince us of his rationality, who feels compelled to murder his bedridden master (Sam Jaffee), driven by obsession with the old man’s blind eye. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Communism
results.brief_description: An example of a propaganda film made in the United States in the early 1950’s informing the viewer of the evils of communism and how to detect those with communist beliefs. Includes historical footage.

results.title: Wagerup weekend
results.brief_description: Examines the campaign by environmentalists to stop the construction of an Alcoa aluminium smelter at Wagerup (near Perth, WA). Looks at the reasons behind the conservation movement and shows the nature of non-violent civil disobedience and its consequences. Highlights the difficulties facing protest groups in Western Australia and the importance of the Courts in their struggle. Suitable for secondary level.
